schedule

Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • schedule.Course

  • public class Course
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single course, including name, days and time scheduled. Assumes that all courses start and end on the hour.
    Author:
    Troy Caro (twc9438@rit.edu)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> days 
      static java.lang.String dayString
      A String containing all possible days as characters, in order ("MTWRF").
      int endTime 
      java.lang.String name 
      int startTime

      Returns a string representing the time this course meets on the given day, if any.

      • Course

        public Course(java.lang.String n,
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> daylist,
      int start,
      int end)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        n - Name of the course.
        daylist - List of days that the course is held on.
        start - Starting time (in hours, 24-hour clock).
        end - Ending time (in hours, 24-hour clock).

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Test for equality.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - Object to be tested against.
        Returns:
        True if the object passed in is a Course with the same name, days, start and end time as this Course.

      • inConflict

        public boolean inConflict(Course other)
        Test for scheduling conflict.
        Parameters:
        other - Course to test against.
        Returns:
        True if the passed-in Course overlaps in time (on any day) with this Course.

      • inDay

        public java.lang.String inDay(int day)
        Returns a string representing the time this course meets on the given day, if any. If it does meet, the String should be in the form Start-end: Name (for example: 8-10: Calculus).
        Parameters:
        day - Day of the week, where 0 = Monday ... 4 = Friday.
        Returns:
        String as above, or the empty String if the course does not meet on the given day.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        String representation of the course, in the form Name: days at start-end (for example: Calculus: MWF at 8-10).
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation.
